title: Citi Reinforces Its Commitment to Kazakhstan
summary: Astana – On May 18-20, Alberto Verme, Citi's CEO for Europe, the Middle East and Africa, came to Kazakhstan on his first official visit to speak at the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) Annual Meeting and Business Forum that took place in Astana. Citi acted as one of the sponsors of this high-profile gathering of some 2,000 business leaders, government officials, NGOs and mass-media representatives.
tag-1: Citi Reinforces Its Commitment to Kazakhstan
tag-3: Astana – On May 18-20, Alberto Verme, Citi's CEO for Europe, the Middle East and Africa, came to Kazakhstan on his first official visit to speak at the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) Annual Meeting and Business Forum that took place in Astana. Citi acted as one of the sponsors of this high-profile gathering of some 2,000 business leaders, government officials, NGOs and mass-media representatives.
tag-4: Asif Zaidi, Citi Country Officer for Kazakhstan, says: "Kazakhstan is among the main emerging markets countries, poised to drive the future growth and development of Citi. Citi sees tremendous potential in this country and will continue to harness all resources and expertise at its disposal to serve its customers in Kazakhstan with distinction and to ensure creating value for our stakeholders and the country."
tag-5: At the Forum's Fostering Entrepreneurship panel session, Alberto Verme highlighted Citi's commitment to the Kazakhstan market and mentioned the importance of innovation, leadership and entrepreneurial spirit from the standpoint of a 200-year-old global financial institution.
tag-6: Citi held a proprietary reception on the sidelines of the EBRD Forum, with more than 200 clients, regulators and government officials attending the event.
tag-7: Prior to the EBRD Business Meeting, Mr. Verme spent one day in Almaty where he met select clients and hosted a town hall for the Almaty employees.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-9: Citi Kazakhstan Citigroup has maintained its presence in Kazakhstan since 1994 when it opened a representative office. In 1998 Citibank Kazakhstan, a 100% subsidiary of Citigroup with a full banking license from the National Bank of Kazakhstan (#247 as of 06/28/1998), opened its doors to corporate customers. Today, Citibank Kazakhstan is a major lending, transactional and investment bank to Kazakhstan corporations, financial institutions, and state owned companies, as well as Kazakhstan subsidiaries and representative offices of leading international firms. Please visit us at www.citi.kz.
